revised_title: Biographical Memoir of Maurice Jules Gaston Corneille Caullery
tldr: The article is a biographical memoir of Maurice Jules Gaston Corneille Caullery, a prominent French zoologist. It covers his early life, education, and scientific career, highlighting his contributions to the fields of zoology and marine biology. Caullery worked under the influence of his teacher Alfred Giard and made significant discoveries in ascidian research. He held various academic positions and was involved in the development of marine zoological laboratories in France. The memoir also discusses Caullery's teaching methods, his influence on the field of biology, and his international connections.
